alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 15 at 9:44PM EDT until April 16 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. .With no additional precipitation for the next few days and decreased snow melt due to colder weather, river levels will slowly fall overnight. For the Escanaba River...including Humboldt...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, County Road FX begins to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EDT Friday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.6 feet Friday evening. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning by 800 AM EDT.
